III. INVESTIGATION
Rule CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Code & requirements; staff qualifications.
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at the facility from 10/01/2015 to 06/06/2018.
Youth was sexually assaulted by a staff member. Additional
details about this incident are unknown.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed on 9/14/23 via phone.
Complainant reported she overheard Youth A telling a peer about
something happening to him at a previous placement.
Complainant took Youth A aside and asked him more information.
Youth A told Complainant when he was placed at the facility when
he was 6 or 7, he was molested by a male staff member. Youth A
said when that staff member stopped working at the facility, Youth
A was then raped by a different male staff member. Youth A told
Complainant he couldn’t remember what either male staff member
looked like or their names because Youth A thought he blocked
the rest of the details out. Complainant stated Youth A was very
forthcoming when talking to her but seemed very uneasy talking
about it. Complainant told Youth A she was going to have to make
a report, which Youth A said he understood. Youth A told
Complainant he just didn’t want to relive the situations repeatedly.
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 9/11/23 by the
Courtesy MDHHS Worker. Youth A refused to allow DCWL
Consultant to be a part of the interview. Youth A refused to be
interviewed by Courtesy MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported the
incident happened a long time ago and he was over it. Youth A
would not provide any further details regarding a timeframe,
location, staff member’s name who allegedly assaulted him, etc.
It should be noted a law enforcement officer attempted to
interview Youth A on 8/31/23 and Youth A also refused to talk
to the officer or provide any further details.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 8/17/23. CA worked at the facility during the time Youth
2

A resided there but does not remember Youth A ever alleging any
staff sexually assaulted him in any way.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on 9/12/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Therapist was not Youth A’s
therapist during his stay at the facility, but she worked with Youth
A in the school setting. Therapist reported she does not remember
Youth A ever complaining about staff interacting inappropriately
with him. She never saw staff acting inappropriately with Youth A.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEWED:
• MDHHS complaints regarding Youth A were reviewed.
Besides this complaint, there are no other complaints about
Youth A being raped or assaulted by any staff members at
the facility.
• CA reviewed Youth A’s chart with Consultant on 8/17/23
and there was no documentation Youth A made any
complaints regarding inappropriate staff interactions with
him during the time Youth A was at the facility.
• Reviewed all of Youth A’s services plans completed during
his placement at the facility. Of note, Youth A has an
extensive sexual abuse history and displayed increased
sexualized behaviors and poor boundaries with staff
members and peers throughout his stay at the facility.
There are no notes of allegations of inappropriate
interactions by any staff members towards Youth A.
• Youth Development Specialist Procedures outlines the
responsibilities for staff to maintain clear and appropriate
boundaries with youth.
Analysis This violation is not established since Youth A refused to be
interviewed and will not provide any details regarding who or when
he was assaulted. According to MDHHS records and Youth A’s
residential services plans, there were no complaints of Youth A
being molested while at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings, the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. However, based on the findings of SIR 2023C0000595,
it is recommended that the current First Provisional License for the facility be
continued.
